US attacks Iran, thrusting Middle East war into total uncertainty
subhead: After pretending to hesitate, Donald Trump took a historic risk by deciding to bomb three Iranian nuclear sites, without congressional authorization. While all eyes are turning to Iran, Israel finds itself with a rare opportunity to bring down the regime in Tehran.

title: The Middle East subjected to the primacy of force
World reacts to US attack against Iran
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Trump's full remarks after US strikes: 'Iran, the bully of the Middle East, must now make peace'
'A furnace': Life under Paris's zinc roofs during a heatwave
subhead: On Saturday, the French capital faced a heatwave, with temperatures reaching up to 36°C. The residents of the city's 'chambres de bonne,' small top-floor flats, struggled to cope.

title: Historian Vincent Duclert: 'Focusing on whether genocide is taking place in Gaza is counterproductive'
subhead: Questioned on May 13 on how to describe the violence in Gaza, French President Emmanuel Macron said it was for historians to say. But are they able to decide? Vincent Duclert, a renowned expert on the genocide of Tutsis in Rwanda, reflects on the mutual contributions of historians and law experts.

title: 'For the French left, inspiration could come from across the Channel'
subhead: With the nationalization of railways, a minimum wage increase and higher employer contributions to fund social protections, Keir Starmer's Labour government could serve as an example of effective left-wing policy, writes economist Philippe Askenazy.

title: From Peru to the Vatican, the rise of 'Monseñor Roberto de Chiclayo,' now Leo XIV
subhead: Francis's successor at the Vatican lived for many years in the South American country. Le Monde traveled to the city of Chiclayo to meet with several people who remember the days when he was still known as Robert Prevost.

Unpacking the tech bros' fascination with the Roman Empire
subhead: Silicon Valley's top executives are almost all captivated by the Roman Empire and its decline. Their obsession shapes how they see the world.
byline: By Damien Leloup and Alexandre Piquard

title: Despite destruction and death, Israelis widely support war against Iran
subhead: The overwhelming majority of the population supports Israel's strikes against Iran, partly because of the nuclear threat but also the hope for regional peace if the regime in Tehran collapses.
byline: By Luc Bronner (Holon, Ramat Gan, Tel-Aviv, special correspondent)

title: Guy Savoy, Michelin-starred chef: 'At 15, I spent all my summer holidays cooking at a refreshment stand'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The multi-Michelin-starred chef recalls the flavors of his childhood in the local public garden, where his parents worked.
